title: Waistcoat Fronts, 1770–80
medium:
Medium: silk, paint
Technique: embroidery using float, satin and chain stitch, painted details
dimensions: H x W x D (each): 67 x 26 cm (26 3/8 x 10 1/4 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Two fronts of a gentleman's waistcoat, with no collar, cut-away hem edge, and shaped pocket flaps, embroidered in twenty-four colors of silk, on an ivory silk ground. Overall tiny floral sprig, floral border at center front edges, floral sprigs and swagged garlands at lower edge.

tombstone.epitaph:
Waistcoat Fronts, 1770–80.
1770–80. Medium: silk, paint
Technique: embroidery using float, satin and chain stitch, painted details. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-54-23-a,b.
